      Source code for pycheron.plotting.psdPlot

      from __future__ import division, absolute_import, print_function

"""
Created on Tue Oct 4 14:58:00 2016
@author: kaaur

PSD plot, useful for plotting instrument corrrected noise values of PSDs and 
PDFs from pycheron package. Creates visualizations for sets of PSDs. Plots generated 
with style ='pdf' mimic plots presented in McNamara paper. Requires data have 
already been read in

Modified by jbobeck (3.5.18)
    -Commented out plt.hold(True), as it is deprecated and giving warnings.
"""

__all__ = ['psdPlot', "_psdPlot_from_database", "_read_psds"]

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib as mpl
from pycheron.psd.psdStatistics import psdStatistics
from pycheron.psd.psdList import psdList
from pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise import getNoise
from pycheron.psd.noise.noiseModel import noiseModel
from obspy.imaging.cm import pqlx
from pycheron.utils import *

from pycheron.db.sqllite_db import Database



      [docs]def psdPlot(st, style='psd', f_name=None, showNoiseModel=True, showMaxMin=False, showMode=False, showMean=False,
            showMedian=True, showEnvelope=True, envelopeType="10_90", showSingle=False, singleType=None, pcolor=pqlx,
            timespan=0, evalresp=None, network=None, station=None, channel=None, location=None,
            session=None, database=None, logger=None):
    """
    Plot instrument corrected noise values of PSDs and PDFs

    :param st: (stream object or Database) - PSD or PDF as output from getNoise or getPDF or Database object
    :type st: obspy.core.stream.Stream or pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database
    :param style: String to determine plotting style, options include psd or pdf
    :type style: str
    :param showNoiseModel: If True, display noise models on the plot
    :type showNoiseModel: bool
    :param showMaxMin: (boolean) - If True, display max and min on the plot
    :type showMaxMin: bool
    :param showMode: (boolean) - If True, display mode on the plot
    :type showMode: bool
    :param showMean: (boolean) - If True, display mean on the plot
    :type showMean: bool
    :param showMedian: (boolean) - If True, display median on the plot
    :type showMedian: bool
    :param showEnvelope: (boolean) - If true, percentile envelope will be plotted.
    :type showEnvelope: boo;
    :param envelopeType: (str) - envelope to be plotted (Default='10_90")
                "10_90" - 10th and 90th percentile envelope
                "05_95" - 5th annd 95th percentile envelope
    :type envelopeType: str
    :param showSingle: (bool) - if True, plot single percentile.
    :type showSingle: bool
    :param singleType: Single line percentile to be plotted. Options: "5" (5th percentile), "10" (10th percentile)
                       "90" ( 90th percentile), "95" (95th percentile).
    :type singleType: str
    :param pcolor: (colormap) - color map to utilize in plots
    :type pcolor: obspy.imaging.cm
    :param evalresp: evalresp directory or np.ndarray
    :type evalresp: str or numpy.ndarray
    :param timespan: (int) Time span for plots to be broken up into. 1 - 1 week, 2 - 2 weeks, 4 - 1 month, Any other int
                    will result in all data being processed.
    :type timespan: int
    :param network: If using database, network name
    :type network: str
    :param station: If using database, station name
    :type station: str
    :param channel: If using database, channel name
    :type channel: str
    :param location: If using database, location name
    :type location: str
    :param session: If using database, session name
    :type session: str
    :param database: database object
    :type database: pycheron.db.sqllite_db.Database
    :param logger: logger object
    :type logger: pycheron.util.logger.Logger


    **Example**

    1. PSD Plot

    .. code-block:: python

        #PSD Plot

        import obspy
        from pycheron.psd.psdList import psdList
        from pycheron.psd.psdStatistics import psdStatistics
        from pycheron.plotting.psdPlot import psdPlot
        from pycheron.psd.getPDF import getPDF
        from pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise import getNoise
        from pycheron.psd.noise.noiseModel import noiseModel
        from obspy.imaging.cm import pqlx


        data = 'test/test_data/7a_cabn_bhe.884965.tar.mseed'

        #reading in stream - show PSD with Statistics and NHNM/NLNM
        st = obspy.read(data)


        psdPlot(st,style='psd', showNoiseModel=True, showMaxMin=True, showMode=True, showMean=True, showMedian=True, showEnvelope=True, envelopeType="10_90",pcolor=pqlx)

    .. image:: _static/psdPlot.png

    2. PDF Plot

    .. code-block:: python

        #PDF Plot

        import obspy
        from pycheron.psd.psdList import psdList
        from pycheron.psd.psdStatistics import psdStatistics
        from pycheron.plotting.psdPlot import psdPlot
        from pycheron.psd.getPDF import getPDF
        from pycheron.psd.noise.getNoise import getNoise
        from pycheron.psd.noise.noiseModel import noiseModel
        from obspy.imaging.cm import pqlx


        data = 'test/test_data/7a_cabn_bhe.884965.tar.mseed'

        #reading in stream - show PSD with Statistics and NHNM/NLNM
        st = obspy.read(data)


        psdPlot(st,style='pdf', showNoiseModel=True, showMaxMin=True, showMode=True, showMean=True, showMedian=True, showEnvelope=True, envelopeType="10_90",pcolor=pqlx)

    .. image:: _static/pdfPlot.png

    """


    if logger is None:
        logger = Logger.Logger(None)

    # Get basic sncl and time information from psd
    # If only one channel in file get the snclq information in the following manner
    plt.close()
    plt.style.use("default")
    if isinstance(st, Database):
        _psdPlot_from_database(st, timespan=timespan, style=style, f_name=f_name, showNoiseModel=showNoiseModel,
                               showMaxMin=showMaxMin, showMode=showMode, showMean=showMean,
                               showMedian=showMedian, showEnvelope=showEnvelope, envelopeType=envelopeType,
                               showSingle=showSingle, singleType=singleType, pcolor=pcolor, network=network,
                               station=station,
                               channel=channel, location=location,
                               session=session, logger=None)
    else:
        network, station, channel, location, quality = parse_snclq(st[0].get_id())

        # If database object, check to see if we already have the psds calculated
        if database is not None:
            time = (st[0].stats.starttime.isoformat(), st[0].stats.endtime.isoformat())
            tb = database.get_metric("psdMetric", network=network, station=station, channel=channel,
                                     location=location,
                                     session=session, time=time)

            # if returns no data, calculate and insert into db
            if tb.empty:
                PSD = psdList(st)
                database.insert_metric(PSD)

            else:
                tb_psds = tb.uncorrected_psds[tb.channel == channel]
                PSD = []
                for j in range(len(tb_psds)):
                    psd = database.extract_masks(tb_psds.iloc[j])
                    PSD.append(psd)
        else:
            PSD = psdList(st)

        if len(PSD) == 1:
            # for i in range(len(PSD[0])):
            #  #Count the number of PSD segments
            psdCount = len(PSD[0])

            # Get snclq information from psdList, then parse out sta, net, chan, loc, frequency.
            # Get starttime of first psd segment and endtime from last psd segment
            snclqSplit = (PSD[0][0][2][0]).split('.')
            network = snclqSplit[0]
            station = snclqSplit[1]
            channel = snclqSplit[3]
            starttime = PSD[0][0][3]
            endtime = PSD[0][-1][4]
            freq = PSD[0][0][0]

            # Generate basic stats as well as noiseMatrix
            stats = psdStatistics(PSD, evalresp=evalresp, logger=logger, database=database)
            noiseMatrix = stats[0]["Noise_Matrix_Noise"]

            # Create period variable for determining plotting xlimits if not broadband B* channel name
            period = 1 / freq

            out = {"network": network, "station": station, "channel": channel, "location": location, "session": session,
                   "metric_name": "psdPlot",
                   "plot_style": style, "timespan": timespan}

            # Default style is psd, but style may be changed to pdf (see below). Plot PSDS from noiseMatrix vs. period,
            # (x axis log), turn on grid and label axes. Have title show how many Corrected PSDs showing with snclq
            if style is 'psd':
                for i in noiseMatrix:
                    plt.semilogx(period, i)
                plt.grid(True, which='both')
                plt.xlabel('Period (s)')
                plt.ylabel('Power (dB)')
                plt.title(
                    "{} Corrected, hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime, endtime, network,
                                                                               station, channel))

            elif style is 'pdf':
                # If style is pdf, flip PDFMatrix because using period, grab out PDF bins
                PDFMatrix = np.fliplr(stats[0]["pdf_matrix"])
                PDFBins = stats[0]["pdf_bins"]
                # Plot colormesh with X = rev(period), y=PDFBins, Z = PDFMatrix. Use pqlx color map and standard 0-30
                # scaling when showing McNamara PSD PDFs. Make x axis scaled logarithmically, label axes, turn on grid and
                # plot colorbar
                plt.pcolormesh(period[::-1], PDFBins, PDFMatrix, cmap=pcolor, alpha=1.0, vmin=0, vmax=30)
                plt.xscale('log')
                plt.ylabel('Amplitude [$m^2/s^4/Hz$] [dB]')
                plt.xlabel('Period (s)')
                plt.title(
                    "PDF plot of {} hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime, endtime, network,
                                                                                station, channel))
                plt.grid(True, which='both')
                plt.colorbar()

            # Choose plotting limits based on channel names
            if channel.startswith('B'):
                plt.xlim(0.1, 100)
            else:
                if min(period) < .001:
                    plt.xlim(.001, max(period))
                else:
                    plt.xlim(min(period), max(period))

            # Choose appropriate dB limits and bin size
            ylo = -200
            yhi = -50
            # Use dB limits in plot yaxis
            plt.ylim(ylo, yhi)

            # Add basic stat lines depending on above TRUE/FALSE call statements (e.g., showMode=TRUE)
            # Show NLNM/NHNM in grey if True; only show from 0.1 -100s
            if showNoiseModel:
                freq_sub = freq[freq <= 10]
                period_sub = 1 / freq[freq <= 10]
                nlnm, nhnm = noiseModel(freq_sub)
                plt.semilogx(period_sub, nlnm, linewidth=2, label='NLNM', color='grey')
                plt.semilogx(period_sub, nhnm, linewidth=2, label='NHNM', color='grey')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": "nlnm"}
                out.update(update)

            # Display max/Min if true as blue and red lines
            if showMaxMin:
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["max"], linewidth=2, label='Max', color='blue')
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["min"], linewidth=2, label='Min', color='red')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": "MinMax"}
                out.update(update)

            # Display mode if true in yellow
            if showMode:
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["mode"], linewidth=2, label='Mode', color='yellow')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": "mode"}
                out.update(update)

            # Display mean if true in orange
            if showMean:
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["mean"], linewidth=2, label='Mean', color='orange')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": "mean"}
                out.update(update)

            # Display median if true in green
            if showMedian:
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["median"], linewidth=2, label='Median', color='green')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": "median"}
                out.update(update)

            # Display the percentile envelopes if true, 10 and 90 or 5 and 95
            if showEnvelope:
                if envelopeType == '10_90':
                    plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_10"], linewidth=2, label='10th Percentile', color='black')
                    plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_90"], linewidth=2, label='90th Percentile', color='black')
                    plt.legend()
                    update = {"type": "envelope_10_90"}
                    out.update(update)
                if envelopeType == '05_95':
                    plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_5"], linewidth=2, label='5th Percentile', color='teal')
                    plt.semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_95"], linewidth=2, label='95th Percentile', color='teal')
                    plt.legend()
                    update = {"type": "envelope_05_95"}
                    out.update(update)

            # If true plot single percentile line
            if showSingle:
                plt.semilogx(period, stats[0][singleType + 'percent'], linewidth=2, label=singleType + 'th Percentile',
                             color='c')
                plt.legend()
                update = {"type": singleType + '_percent'}
                out.update(update)

            # Save figure into designated directory if f_name not none
            if f_name is not None:
                name = f_name + '_' + channel + '.png'
                plt.savefig(name)

                update = {"image_path": name}
                out.update(update)

            if isinstance(st, Database) or database is not None:
                database.insert_metric(out)

        # If more than one channel exists in the file, plotting and obtaining
        # snclq, stats, PSD information must account for all of the channels
        elif len(PSD) != 1:

            # # Create fig, ax handle for subplots defined by the number of PSDs, will allow user
            # # to see multiple channels on same plot
            fig, ax = plt.subplots(len(PSD), 1, figsize=(15, 15))

            # Count the number of PSD segments, this should be the same for each
            # individual channel (or we assume they will be the same until an example proves otherwise (may want to change
            # this in the future

            psdCount = len(PSD[0])

            # Cycle through the PSDs to get the appropriate snclq information from psdList,
            # then parse out sta,net,chan,loc,frequency. We expect these to be
            # #the same but in the case where a file might have multiple channel types we parse
            # them out individually in case the channels, locs, freq may be
            # different. Get starttime for first psd segment and endtime from last psd
            # segment for each different channel.

            for i in range(len(PSD)):
                network, station, channel, location, quality = parse_snclq(PSD[i][0][2][0])
                starttime = PSD[i][0][3]
                endtime = PSD[i][-1][4]
                freq = PSD[i][0][0]

                out = {"network": network, "station": station, "channel": channel, "location": location,
                       "session": session,
                       "metric_name": "psdPlot",
                       "plot_style": style, "timespan": timespan}

                # Generate basic stats as well as noiseMatrix.
                # Inside loop so that we can get the appropriate noise matrices for each channel
                stats = psdStatistics(PSD, evalresp=evalresp, logger=logger, database=database)
                noiseMatrix = stats[0]["noise_matrix_noise"]

                # Create period variable for determining plotting xlimits if not broadband B*
                # channel name. On the off chance that the frequencies are different within the
                # file we will make a list of periods based on i.
                period = 1 / freq

                # Get noise and PDF based on psd
                f, n, PSD = getNoise(PSD, evalresp=None)

                # Default style is psd, but style may be changed to pdf (see below). Same as above: Plot PSDS from
                # noiseMatrix vs. period for each channel in PSD. (x axis log), turn on grid and label axes.
                # Have title show how many Corrected PSDs showing with snclq
                if style is 'psd':
                    for j in noiseMatrix:
                        ax[i].semilogx(period, j)
                        ax[i].set_title("{} Corrected, hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount,
                                                                                                   starttime, endtime,
                                                                                                   network, station,
                                                                                                   channel))
                ax[i].grid(True, which='both')
                ax[i].set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                ax[i].set_ylabel('Power (dB)')

                if style is 'pdf':
                    # If style is pdf, flip PDFMatrix because using period, grab out PDF bins
                    PDFMatrix = np.fliplr(stats[0]["pdf_matrix"])
                    PDFBins = stats[0]["pdf_bins"]
                    # Plot colormesh with X = rev(period), y=PDFBins, Z = PDFMatrix. Use pqlx color map and standard 0-30
                    # scaling when showing McNamara PSD PDFs. Make x axis scaled logarithmically, label axes, turn on grid and
                    # plot colorbar
                    im = ax[i].pcolormesh(period[::-1], PDFBins, PDFMatrix, cmap=pcolor, alpha=1.0, vmin=0, vmax=30)
                    ax[i].set_xscale('log')
                    ax[i].set_ylabel('Amplitude [$m^2/s^4/Hz$] [dB]')
                    ax[i].set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                    ax[i].set_title(
                        "PDF plot of {} hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime, endtime,
                                                                                    network,
                                                                                    station, channel))
                    ax[i].grid(True, which='both')

                # Choose plotting limits based on channel names
                if channel.startswith('B'):
                    ax[i].set_xlim(0.1, 100)
                else:
                    if min(period) < .001:
                        ax[i].set_xlim(.001, max(period))
                    else:
                        ax[i].set_xlim(min(period), max(period))

                # Choose appropriate dB limits and bin size. Not necessary to be in
                # loop, but need info for getPDF which needs to be in loop
                ylo = -200
                yhi = -50

                # Use dB limits in plot yaxis
                ax[i].set_ylim(ylo, yhi)

                # Add basic stat lines depending on above TRUE/FALSE call statements (e.g., showMode=TRUE)
                #  Show NLNM/NHNM in grey if True; only show from 0.1 -100s
                if showNoiseModel:
                    freq_sub = freq[freq <= 10]
                    period_sub = 1 / freq[freq <= 10]
                    nlnm, nhnm = noiseModel(freq_sub)
                    ax[i].semilogx(period_sub, nlnm, linewidth=2, label='NLNM', color='grey')
                    ax[i].semilogx(period_sub, nhnm, linewidth=2, label='NHNM', color='grey')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": "nlnm"}
                        out.update(update)

                # If True, display the min/max in blue, red
                if showMaxMin:
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["max"], linewidth=2, label='Max', color='blue')
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["min"], linewidth=2, label='Min', color='red')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": "MinMax"}
                        out.update(update)

                # If True, display the mode in yellow
                if showMode:
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["mode"], linewidth=2, label='Mode', color='yellow')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": "mode"}
                        out.update(update)

                # If true, display the mean in orange
                if showMean:
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["mean"], linewidth=2, label='Mean', color='orange')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": "mean"}
                        out.update(update)

                # If true, display the median in green
                if showMedian:
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["median"], linewidth=2, label='Median', color='green')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": "median"}
                        out.update(update)

                # Display the percentile envelopes if true, 10 and 90 or 5 and 95
                if showEnvelope:
                    if envelopeType == '10_90':
                        ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_10"], linewidth=2, label='10th Percentile',
                                       color='black')
                        ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_90"], linewidth=2, label='90th Percentile',
                                       color='black')
                        ax[i].legend()
                        if i == 0:
                            update = {"type": "envelope_10_90"}
                            out.update(update)

                    if envelopeType == '05_95':
                        ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]['05percent'], linewidth=2, label='5th Percentile', color='teal')
                        ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0]["percent_95"], linewidth=2, label='95th Percentile',
                                       color='teal')
                        ax[i].legend()
                        if i == 0:
                            update = {"type": "envelope_05_95"}
                            out.update(update)

                # If true plot single percentile line
                if showSingle:
                    ax[i].semilogx(period, stats[0][singleType + 'percent'], linewidth=2,
                                   label=singleType + 'th Percentile',
                                   color='c')
                    ax[i].legend()
                    if i == 0:
                        update = {"type": singleType + '_percent'}
                        out.update(update)

                # Plot colorbar for pdfs
                if style is 'pdf':
                    cax, kw = mpl.colorbar.make_axes([axes for axes in ax.flat])
                    plt.colorbar(im, cax=cax, **kw)

                # Save figure into designated directory if f_name not none
                if f_name is not None:
                    name = f_name + '_' + station + '.png'
                    plt.savefig(name)

                    update = {"image_path": name}
                    out.update(update)

                if isinstance(st, Database) or database is not None:
                    database.insert_metric(out)

                plt.close()
      


def _psdPlot_from_database(database, style='psd', f_name=None, showNoiseModel=True, showMaxMin=False, showMode=False,
                           showMean=False,
                           showMedian=True, showEnvelope=True, envelopeType="10_90", showSingle=False, singleType=None,
                           pcolor=pqlx, timespan=1, network=None, station=None, channel=None, location=None,
                           session=None, logger=None):
    """
    Internal function used by psdPlot if inout is Database
    """
    # Get basic sncl and time information from psd
    # If only one channel in file get the snclq information in the following manner

    psd_channels = _read_psds(database, timespan=timespan, network=network, station=station,
                              channel=channel, location=location,
                              session=session, logger=logger)
    
    # If psd_channels is empty exit
    if not psd_channels:
        return
    
    out_list = []
    # looping thru each channel
    for psds in psd_channels:

        count_date_chunk = 0

        network, station, channel, location, quality = parse_snclq(psds[0][0][0][0][2][0])

        out = {"network": network, "station": station, "channel": channel, "location": location,
               "session": session,
               "metric_name": "psdPlot",
               "plot_style": style, "timespan": timespan}

        type = []

        for date_chunk in psds:
            if len(date_chunk) == 1:

                fig, ax = plt.subplots(len(date_chunk), 1, figsize=(15, 15))

                # Cycle through the PSDs to get the appropriate snclq information from psdList,
                # then parse out sta,net,chan,loc,frequency. We expect these to be
                # #the same but in the case where a file might have multiple channel types we parse
                # them out individually in case the channels, locs, freq may be
                # different. Get starttime for first psd segment and endtime from last psd
                # segment for each different channel.
                # looping through each channel
                for i in range(len(date_chunk)):

                    count_stats = 0
                    # need to aggregate models for each day into however many days per date_chunk
                    try:
                        starttime = str(date_chunk[0][0][0][3])[0:19]
                        endtime = str(date_chunk[-1][-1][-1][4])[0:19]
                    except IndexError:
                        continue
                    stats = psdStatistics(date_chunk[i], logger=logger, database=database)
                    noise_agg = 0
                    max_agg = 0
                    min_agg = 0
                    mode_agg = 0
                    mean_agg = 0
                    median_agg = 0
                    per10_agg = 0
                    per90_agg = 0
                    per05_agg = 0
                    per95_agg = 0
                    for j in range(len(stats) - 1):
                        # Generate basic stats as well as noiseMatrix.
                        # Inside loop so that we can get the appropriate noise matrices for each channel
                        try:
                            if stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[j + 1]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape and \
                                    stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[-j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape:

                                noise_agg = stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"] + noise_agg
                                max_agg = stats[j]["max"] + max_agg
                                min_agg = stats[j]["min"] + min_agg
                                mode_agg = stats[j]["mode"] + mode_agg
                                mean_agg = stats[j]["mean"] + mean_agg
                                median_agg = stats[j]["median"] + median_agg
                                per10_agg = stats[j]["percent_10"] + per10_agg
                                per90_agg = stats[j]["percent_90"] + per95_agg
                                per05_agg = stats[j]["percent_5"] + per05_agg
                                per95_agg = stats[j]["percent_95"] + per90_agg
                                count_stats += 1
                            else:
                                continue
                        except IndexError:
                            if stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[j - 1]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape and \
                                    stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[-j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape:
                                noise_agg = stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"] + noise_agg
                                max_agg = stats[j]["max"] + max_agg
                                min_agg = stats[j]["min"] + min_agg
                                mode_agg = stats[j]["mode"] + mode_agg
                                mean_agg = stats[j]["mean"] + mean_agg
                                median_agg = stats[j]["median"] + median_agg
                                per10_agg = stats[j]["percent_10"] + per10_agg
                                per90_agg = stats[j]["percent_90"] + per95_agg
                                per05_agg = stats[j]["percent_5"] + per05_agg
                                per95_agg = stats[j]["percent_95"] + per90_agg
                                count_stats += 1
                            else:
                                continue
                        except ValueError:
                            continue
                    if count_stats != 0:
                        noise_agg = noise_agg / count_stats
                        max_agg = max_agg / count_stats
                        min_agg = min_agg / count_stats
                        mode_agg = mode_agg / count_stats
                        mean_agg = mean_agg / count_stats
                        median_agg = mean_agg / count_stats
                        per10_agg = per10_agg / count_stats
                        per90_agg = per90_agg / count_stats
                        per05_agg = per05_agg / count_stats
                        per95_agg = per95_agg / count_stats
                    else:
                        continue

                    psdCount = 0
                    # looping through each day
                    for j in range(len(date_chunk[i])):
                        # Count the number of PSD segments, this should be the same for each
                        # individual channel (or we assume they will be the same until an example proves otherwise (may want to change
                        # this in the future

                        psdCount = psdCount + len(date_chunk[i][j])

                        freq = np.asarray(date_chunk[i][j][0][0])

                        # Create period variable for determining plotting xlimits if not broadband B*
                        # channel name. On the off chance that the frequencies are different within the
                        # file we will make a list of periods based on i.
                        period = 1 / freq

                        # Default style is psd, but style may be changed to pdf (see below). Same as above: Plot PSDS from
                        # noiseMatrix vs. period for each channel in PSD. (x axis log), turn on grid and label axes.
                        # Have title show how many Corrected PSDs showing with snclq
                        if style is 'psd':
                            for k in noise_agg:
                                ax.semilogx(period, k, lw=.5)
                                ax.set_title("{} Corrected, hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount,
                                                                                                           starttime,
                                                                                                           endtime,
                                                                                                           network,
                                                                                                           station,
                                                                                                           channel))
                        ax.grid(True, which='both')
                        ax.set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                        ax.set_ylabel('Power (dB)')

                        if style is 'pdf':
                            # If style is pdf, flip PDFMatrix because using period, grab out PDF bins
                            PDFMatrix = np.fliplr(stats[j]["pdf_matrix"])
                            PDFBins = stats[j]["pdf_bins"]
                            # Plot colormesh with X = rev(period), y=PDFBins, Z = PDFMatrix. Use pqlx color map and standard 0-30
                            # scaling when showing McNamara PSD PDFs. Make x axis scaled logarithmically, label axes, turn on grid and
                            # plot colorbar
                            im = ax.pcolormesh(period[::-1], PDFBins, PDFMatrix, cmap=pcolor, alpha=1.0, vmin=0,
                                                  vmax=30)
                            ax.set_xscale('log')

                            ax.set_title(
                                "PDF plot of {} hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime,
                                                                                            endtime,
                                                                                            network,
                                                                                            station, channel))

                            ax.grid(True, which='both')
                            ax.grid(True, which='both')
                            ax.set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                            ax.set_ylabel('Power (dB)')

                        # Choose appropriate dB limits and bin size. Not necessary to be in
                        # loop, but need info for getPDF which needs to be in loop
                        ylo = -200
                        yhi = -50

                        # Use dB limits in plot yaxis
                        ax.set_ylim(ylo, yhi)

                        # Add basic stat lines depending on above TRUE/FALSE call statements (e.g., showMode=TRUE)
                        #  Show NLNM/NHNM in grey if True; only show from 0.1 -100s
                        if showNoiseModel:
                            freq_sub = freq[freq <= 10]
                            period_sub = 1 / freq[freq <= 10]
                            nlnm, nhnm = noiseModel(freq_sub)
                            ax.semilogx(period_sub, nlnm, linewidth=2, label='NLHM/NLNM' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='grey')
                            ax.semilogx(period_sub, nhnm, linewidth=2, color='grey')



                        # If True, display the min/max in blue, red
                        if showMaxMin:
                            ax.semilogx(period, max_agg, linewidth=2, label='Max' if j == 0 else "", color='red')
                            ax.semilogx(period, min_agg, linewidth=2, label='Min' if j == 0 else "", color='blue')



                        # If True, display the mode in yellow
                        if showMode:
                            ax.semilogx(period, mode_agg, linewidth=2, label='Mode' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='yellow')


                        # If true, display the mean in orange
                        if showMean:
                            ax.semilogx(period, mean_agg, linewidth=2, label='Mean' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='orange')



                        # If true, display the median in green
                        if showMedian:
                            ax.semilogx(period, median_agg, linewidth=2, label='Median' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='green')



                        # Display the percentile envelopes if true, 10 and 90 or 5 and 95
                        if showEnvelope:
                            if envelopeType == '10_90':
                                ax.semilogx(period, per10_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label='10th/90th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='black')
                                ax.semilogx(period, per90_agg, linewidth=2,

                                               color='black')



                            if envelopeType == '05_95':
                                ax.semilogx(period, per05_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label='5th/10th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='teal')
                                ax.semilogx(period, per95_agg, linewidth=2,

                                               color='teal')


                        # If true plot single percentile line
                        if showSingle:
                            if singleType + 'percent' == "percent_10":
                                ax.semilogx(period, per10_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')

                            elif singleType + 'percent' == "percent_90":
                                ax.semilogx(period, per90_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')


                            elif singleType + 'percent' == "percent_5":
                                ax.semilogx(period, per05_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')

                            else:
                                ax.semilogx(period, per95_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')


                    # Choose plotting limits based on channel names
                    if channel.startswith('B'):
                        ax.set_xlim(0.1, 100)
                    else:
                        if min(period) < .01:
                            ax.set_xlim(.1, max(period))
                        else:
                            ax.set_xlim(min(period), max(period))

                    ax.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(0., 1.02, 1., .102), loc=3,
                                 ncol=len(period), mode="expand", borderaxespad=3.)

                    # Plot colorbar for pdfs
                    if style is 'pdf':
                        # If style is pdf, flip PDFMatrix because using period, grab out PDF bins
                        PDFMatrix = np.fliplr(stats[0]["pdf_matrix"])
                        PDFBins = stats[0]["pdf_bins"]
                        # Plot colormesh with X = rev(period), y=PDFBins, Z = PDFMatrix. Use pqlx color map and standard 0-30
                        # scaling when showing McNamara PSD PDFs. Make x axis scaled logarithmically, label axes, turn on grid and
                        # plot colorbar
                        im = ax.pcolormesh(period[::-1], PDFBins, PDFMatrix, cmap=pcolor, alpha=1.0, vmin=0, vmax=30)
                        ax.set_xscale('log')
                        ax.set_ylabel('Amplitude [$m^2/s^4/Hz$] [dB]')
                        ax.set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                        ax.set_title(
                            "PDF plot of {} hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime, endtime,
                                                                                        network,
                                                                                        station, channel))
                        ax.grid(True, which='both')

                        plt.colorbar(im)

                    count_date_chunk += 1

                    # Save figure into designated directory if f_name not none
                    if f_name is not None:
                        name = f_name + '_' + station + '_' + str(count_date_chunk) + '.png'
                        plt.savefig(name)

                        update = {"image_path": name}
                        out.update(update)



            # If more than one channel exists in the file, plotting and obtaining
            # snclq, stats, PSD information must account for all of the channels
            else:
                # # Create fig, ax handle for subplots defined by the number of PSDs, will allow user
                # # to see multiple channels on same plot
                fig, ax = plt.subplots(len(date_chunk), 1, figsize=(15, 15))

                # Cycle through the PSDs to get the appropriate snclq information from psdList,
                # then parse out sta,net,chan,loc,frequency. We expect these to be
                # #the same but in the case where a file might have multiple channel types we parse
                # them out individually in case the channels, locs, freq may be
                # different. Get starttime for first psd segment and endtime from last psd
                # segment for each different channel.
                # looping through each channel
                for i in range(len(date_chunk)):

                    count_stats = 0
                    # need to aggregate models for each day into however many days per date_chunk
                    try:
                        starttime = str(date_chunk[0][0][0][3])[0:19]
                        endtime = str(date_chunk[-1][-1][-1][4])[0:19]
                    except IndexError:
                        continue
                    stats = psdStatistics(date_chunk[i],logger=logger, database=database)
                    noise_agg = 0
                    max_agg = 0
                    min_agg = 0
                    mode_agg = 0
                    mean_agg = 0
                    median_agg = 0
                    per10_agg = 0
                    per90_agg = 0
                    per05_agg = 0
                    per95_agg = 0
                    for j in range(len(stats) - 1):
                        # Generate basic stats as well as noiseMatrix.
                        # Inside loop so that we can get the appropriate noise matrices for each channel
                        try:
                            if stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[j + 1]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape and \
                                    stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[-j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape:

                                noise_agg = stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"] + noise_agg
                                max_agg = stats[j]["max"] + max_agg
                                min_agg = stats[j]["min"] + min_agg
                                mode_agg = stats[j]["mode"] + mode_agg
                                mean_agg = stats[j]["mean"] + mean_agg
                                median_agg = stats[j]["median"] + median_agg
                                per10_agg = stats[j]["percent_10"] + per10_agg
                                per90_agg = stats[j]["percent_90"] + per95_agg
                                per05_agg = stats[j]["percent_5"] + per05_agg
                                per95_agg = stats[j]["percent_95"] + per90_agg
                                count_stats += 1
                            else:
                                continue
                        except IndexError:
                            if stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[j - 1]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape and \
                                    stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape == stats[-j]["noise_matrix_noise"].shape:
                                noise_agg = stats[j]["noise_matrix_noise"] + noise_agg
                                max_agg = stats[j]["max"] + max_agg
                                min_agg = stats[j]["min"] + min_agg
                                mode_agg = stats[j]["mode"] + mode_agg
                                mean_agg = stats[j]["mean"] + mean_agg
                                median_agg = stats[j]["median"] + median_agg
                                per10_agg = stats[j]["percent_10"] + per10_agg
                                per90_agg = stats[j]["percent_90"] + per95_agg
                                per05_agg = stats[j]["percent_5"] + per05_agg
                                per95_agg = stats[j]["percent_95"] + per90_agg
                                count_stats += 1
                            else:
                                continue
                        except ValueError:
                            continue
                    if count_stats != 0:
                        noise_agg = noise_agg / count_stats
                        max_agg = max_agg / count_stats
                        min_agg = min_agg / count_stats
                        mode_agg = mode_agg / count_stats
                        mean_agg = mean_agg / count_stats
                        median_agg = mean_agg / count_stats
                        per10_agg = per10_agg / count_stats
                        per90_agg = per90_agg / count_stats
                        per05_agg = per05_agg / count_stats
                        per95_agg = per95_agg / count_stats
                    else:
                        continue

                    psdCount = 0
                    # looping through each day
                    for j in range(len(date_chunk[i])):
                        # Count the number of PSD segments, this should be the same for each
                        # individual channel (or we assume they will be the same until an example proves otherwise (may want to change
                        # this in the future

                        psdCount = psdCount + len(date_chunk[i][j])

                        freq = np.asarray(date_chunk[i][j][0][0])

                        # Create period variable for determining plotting xlimits if not broadband B*
                        # channel name. On the off chance that the frequencies are different within the
                        # file we will make a list of periods based on i.
                        period = 1 / freq

                        # Default style is psd, but style may be changed to pdf (see below). Same as above: Plot PSDS from
                        # noiseMatrix vs. period for each channel in PSD. (x axis log), turn on grid and label axes.
                        # Have title show how many Corrected PSDs showing with snclq
                        if style is 'psd':
                            for k in noise_agg:
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, k, lw=.5)
                                ax[i].set_title("{} Corrected, hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount,
                                                                                                           starttime,
                                                                                                           endtime,
                                                                                                           network,
                                                                                                           station,
                                                                                                           channel))
                        ax[i].grid(True, which='both')
                        ax[len(date_chunk) - 1].set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                        ax[i].set_ylabel('Power (dB)')

                        if style is 'pdf':
                            # If style is pdf, flip PDFMatrix because using period, grab out PDF bins
                            PDFMatrix = np.fliplr(stats[j]["pdf_matrix"])
                            PDFBins = stats[j]["pdf_bins"]
                            # Plot colormesh with X = rev(period), y=PDFBins, Z = PDFMatrix. Use pqlx color map and standard 0-30
                            # scaling when showing McNamara PSD PDFs. Make x axis scaled logarithmically, label axes, turn on grid and
                            # plot colorbar
                            im = ax[i].pcolormesh(period[::-1], PDFBins, PDFMatrix, cmap=pcolor, alpha=1.0, vmin=0,
                                                  vmax=30)
                            ax[i].set_xscale('log')

                            ax[i].set_title(
                                "PDF plot of {} hourly PSDs from {}-{} for {}.{}.{}".format(psdCount, starttime,
                                                                                            endtime,
                                                                                            network,
                                                                                            station, channel))

                            ax[i].grid(True, which='both')
                            ax[i].grid(True, which='both')
                            ax[len(date_chunk) - 1].set_xlabel('Period (s)')
                            ax[i].set_ylabel('Power (dB)')

                        # Choose appropriate dB limits and bin size. Not necessary to be in
                        # loop, but need info for getPDF which needs to be in loop
                        ylo = -200
                        yhi = -50

                        # Use dB limits in plot yaxis
                        ax[i].set_ylim(ylo, yhi)

                        # Add basic stat lines depending on above TRUE/FALSE call statements (e.g., showMode=TRUE)
                        #  Show NLNM/NHNM in grey if True; only show from 0.1 -100s
                        if showNoiseModel:
                            freq_sub = freq[freq <= 10]
                            period_sub = 1 / freq[freq <= 10]
                            nlnm, nhnm = noiseModel(freq_sub)
                            ax[i].semilogx(period_sub, nlnm, linewidth=2, label='NLHM/NLNM' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='grey')
                            ax[i].semilogx(period_sub, nhnm, linewidth=2, color='grey')
                            if i == 0:
                                type.append("nlnm")


                        # If True, display the min/max in blue, red
                        if showMaxMin:
                            ax[i].semilogx(period, max_agg, linewidth=2, label='Max' if j == 0 else "", color='red')
                            ax[i].semilogx(period, min_agg, linewidth=2, label='Min' if j == 0 else "", color='blue')
                            if i == 0:
                                type.append("MinMax")


                        # If True, display the mode in yellow
                        if showMode:
                            ax[i].semilogx(period, mode_agg, linewidth=2, label='Mode' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='yellow')
                            if i == 0:
                                type.append("mode")

                        # If true, display the mean in orange
                        if showMean:
                            ax[i].semilogx(period, mean_agg, linewidth=2, label='Mean' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='orange')
                            if i == 0:
                                type.append("mean")


                        # If true, display the median in green
                        if showMedian:
                            ax[i].semilogx(period, median_agg, linewidth=2, label='Median' if j == 0 else "",
                                           color='green')
                            if i == 0:
                                type.append("median")


                        # Display the percentile envelopes if true, 10 and 90 or 5 and 95
                        if showEnvelope:
                            if envelopeType == '10_90':
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per10_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label='10th/90th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='black')
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per90_agg, linewidth=2,

                                               color='black')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append("envelope_10_90")


                            if envelopeType == '05_95':
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per05_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label='5th/10th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='teal')
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per95_agg, linewidth=2,

                                               color='teal')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append("envelope_05_95")


                        # If true plot single percentile line
                        if showSingle:
                            if singleType + 'percent' == "percent_10":
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per10_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append("percent_10")

                            elif singleType + 'percent' == "percent_90":
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per90_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append("percent_90")

                            elif singleType + 'percent' == "percent_5":
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per05_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append("percent_5")

                            else:
                                ax[i].semilogx(period, per95_agg, linewidth=2,
                                               label=singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "",
                                               color='c')
                                if i == 0:
                                    type.append(singleType + 'th Percentile' if j == 0 else "")

                    # Choose plotting limits based on channel names
                    if channel.startswith('B'):
                        ax[i].set_xlim(0.1, 100)
                    else:
                        if min(period) < .01:
                            ax[i].set_xlim(.1, max(period))
                        else:
                            ax[i].set_xlim(min(period), max(period))

                    ax[0].legend(bbox_to_anchor=(0., 1.02, 1., .102), loc=3,
                                 ncol=len(period), mode="expand", borderaxespad=3.)

                    # Plot colorbar for pdfs
                    if style is 'pdf':
                        cax, kw = mpl.colorbar.make_axes([axes for axes in ax.flat])
                        plt.colorbar(im, cax=cax, **kw)

                    count_date_chunk += 1

                    # Save figure into designated directory if f_name not none
                    if f_name is not None:
                        name = f_name + '_' + station + '_' + str(count_date_chunk) + '.png'
                        plt.savefig(name)

                        update = {"image_path": name}
                        out.update(update)


            type = np.unique(type)
            update = {"type": list(type)}
            out.update(update)
            out_list.append(out)

            if isinstance(database, Database) or database is not None:
                database.insert_metric(out_list)

    return out_list


def _read_psds(database, timespan=0, network=None, station=None, channel=None, location=None,
               session=None, logger=None):
    """
    Internal function to read psd from db
    """
    psds = []
    chans = []
    d = []

    tb = database.get_metric("psdMetric", network, station, channel, location,
                             session=session)

    if tb.empty:
        logger.error(
            "psdPlot Error: No psdMetric found for specific network in Database, please run psdMetric first")
        return

    else:
        tb_psds = tb.uncorrected_psds[tb.station == station]

        for j in range(len(tb_psds)):
            psd = database.extract_masks(tb_psds.iloc[j])
            try:
                snclq = psd[0][2][0]
            except IndexError:
                print("Empty PSD file. Skipping")
                continue
            channel = snclq.split(".")[3]
            chans.append(channel)
            psds.append(psd)
            d.append(psd[0][3])
    chans = np.unique(chans)
    d = sorted(np.unique(d))

    # Setting date ranges
    all_dates = []
    dates = []
    # one week of data
    if timespan == 1:
        i = 0
        while len(dates) <= 6 and i < len(d):
            dates.append(d[i])
            i += 1
            if len(dates) == 7 or i == len(d):
                all_dates.append(dates)
                dates = []

    # 2 weeks of data
    elif timespan == 2:
        i = 0
        while len(dates) <= 13 and i < len(d):
            dates.append(d[i])
            i += 1
            if len(dates) == 14 or i == len(d):
                all_dates.append(dates)
                dates = []

    # one month of data
    elif timespan == 4:
        i = 0
        while len(dates) <= 27 and i < len(d):
            dates.append(d[i])
            i += 1
            if len(dates) == 28 or i == len(d):
                all_dates.append(dates)
                dates = []
    # plot all
    else:
        all_dates.append(d)

    all = []
    #loop through channels
    for chan in chans:
        # List that holds a list of date ranges, containing a list of channels for each date range. ex.
        #[7-day date range1:[ chan1: [day 1: [psds], day 2: [psds]], chan2: [etc.]],
        # 7-day date range1:[ chan1: [day 8: [psds], day 9: [psds], chan2: [etc.]]]

        all_subchan = []
        # loop thru the date ranges
        for date_range in all_dates:
            date_chunk = []
            chan_e = []
            chan_n = []
            chan_z = []
            for day in date_range:
                for psd in psds:
                    try:
                        snclq = psd[0][2][0]
                    except IndexError:
                        print("dailyPDFPlot Warning: Error in PSD file. Skipping PSD...")
                        continue
                    channel = snclq.split(".")[3]
                    start = psd[0][3]
                    # if first letter matches
                    if channel.startswith(chan) and start == day:
                        if channel.endswith("E") or channel.endswith("1"):
                            chan_e.append(psd)
                        elif channel.endswith("N") or channel.endswith("2"):
                            chan_n.append(psd)
                        else:
                            chan_z.append(psd)
                # making sure channel is not empty and not missing sub channel (ei E, N, Z)
            if chan_e:
                date_chunk.append(chan_e)
            if chan_n:
                date_chunk.append(chan_n)
            if chan_z:
                date_chunk.append(chan_z)

            all_subchan.append(date_chunk)
        all.append(all_subchan)
    return all
